titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Duke Inquiries into Social Relations records, 2014 UA.31.08.0008

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-11-07 11:32:32 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Duke Inquiries into Social Relations records
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: A report and presentation slideshow regarding social and gender relations among undergraduates. The report was released in April 2014.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.

Electronic records in this collection have been migrated to a library server and digital use copies can only be accessed onsite in the Rubenstein Library Reading Room. To request access, please contact Research Services before coming to use these records.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for official university records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Duke Inquiries into Social Relations records, 2014, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: UA2014-0030

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Duke Inquiries into Social Relations was a student-run organization that aimed to investigate and raise awareness of the state of social and gender relations among undergraduates.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: A report and presentation slide regarding social and gender relations among undergraduates. The report was released in April 2014.

did.physdesc: 1 PDF file and 1 PowerPoint file; approximately 1 megabyte.

dao.xlink:title: Duke Inquiries into Social Relations Report and Presentation Slide

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Electronic records in this file have been migrated to a library server and digital use copies can only be accessed onsite in the Rubenstein Library Reading Room. To request access, please contact Research Services before coming to use these records.
